title: Tinder Wrapped
description: Look at your year in review with Tinder Wrapped. This works by requesting a copy of your data as required by the GPDR, once you have obtained a copy of your data upload it to the site and it will parse the data to give your year stats of tinder. It was built using HTML, TailwindCSS, and Javascript for the json parsing. It runs on a docker container using Node.js to run host the server.

title: Kayley Hennessy Portfolio
description: This is a portfolio site built to showcase the work of Kayley Hennessy. It was built using next.js with custom built components. It is SEO optimized and is built using the latest web technologies.

title: Sudbury.News
description: This site is a news aggregator for Sudbury, Ontario. It is built using wordpress and pulls the data for the news articles from the local news RSS feeds. This site was built for a client who wanted to have a news site that was easy to update and maintain. It is SEO optimized and is built using the latest web technologies. It has climbed in number of visitors and is on track to reach 1000 mothly clicks.

title: Twitter Data Miner
description: This project was created as a way to determine the sentiment associated with a given tweet. Users are able to enter username and either select tweet replies or mentions and analyze the sentiment that is associated with them.

title: Dhar Mann TikTok Bot
description: This is a TikTok bot to create the low effort content that is commonly found on tiktok which consists of a dhar mann video on the top with either a video of game play, or some sensory video on the bottom.

title: NachOS
description: NACHO stands for Not Another Completely Heuristic Operating System. It was created as part of a class in Operating Systems. The goal of the project was to create a simple operating system that could run on a virtual machine.

title: NPX Card
description: This project is a simple npx card that can be used to display information about myself. It was created using node.js and can be installed using npx.

title: Netflix Lightmode
description: This project was created as part of a class in User Interface Design. The goal of the project was to create implement a UI change in an existing web site or service. I decided on creating a lightmode version of the Netflix website. The project was built using HTML, CSS, and Javascript and can be installed as a chrome extension.
